Paragraph: However , while DES - induced pituitary growth exhibited quantitative , additive inheritance , the hemorrhagic phenotype exhibited recessive , epistatic inheritance .

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

| Disease |
| --- |
| DES-induced pituitary growth |
| hemorrhagic phenotype |

DES refers to Diethylstilbestrol, a synthetic form of estrogen that was used in the past to prevent miscarriages and premature labor. The paragraph discusses two different phenotypes (manifestations of a disease or condition) that result from DES exposure: pituitary growth and hemorrhagic phenotype. The former is described as having quantitative, additive inheritance, while the latter is described as having recessive, epistatic inheritance. Therefore, both DES-induced pituitary growth and hemorrhagic phenotype are valid disease entities.
